definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: I just couldn't remember it's name last night but I have been looking forward to seeing it for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 其實我一直盼望着去看看，但昨晚老記不住名字。

sentences.english: Her problem: She can't remember them.
sentences.chinese: 她的問題在於她記不住。

sentences.english: Amnesia sufferers usually cannot remember their identity or name.
sentences.chinese: 失憶症患者常常記不住他們的身份或名字。

sentences.english: And at moments you just can't remember your lines.
sentences.chinese: 但是這時你就是記不住臺詞。

sentences.english: Many actors have difficulty in learning their lines, and get them wrong even after a lot of practice.
sentences.chinese: 許我演員記不住臺詞，排練了許多次以後還是要搞錯。

sentences.english: Finding that he could not remember a word of the letter either.
sentences.chinese: 獄卒發現自己連一個字也記不住。

sentences.english: Even the honors kids do not retain much by the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 年底的時候，連優等生也記不住多少所學的東西。

sentences.english: Show me, and I may not reme ber.
sentences.chinese: 給我看，我可能也記不住。

sentences.english: Many of them spend hours in memorizing vocabularies but are still having a hard time in remembering them.
sentences.chinese: 很多人花大量的時間去背單詞，但是卻仍然記不住。

sentences.english: She couldn't remember my log-ons and passwords, no matter how many times I wrote them down for her.
sentences.chinese: 無論我說多少次，她老是記不住我的登錄名和密碼。

sentences.english: Relaxed: Men tend to have dull dreams that often cannot even be remembered (posed by model)
sentences.chinese: 男人們的夢往往很無聊，他們通常也記不住。

sentences.english: Actually he is very bad at remembering passwords.
sentences.chinese: 實際上他記性非常差，記不住密碼。
